13. Formality Net¶

Formality terms are compiled to a memory-efficient interaction net system. Interaction nets are just graphs where nodes have labelled ports, one being the main one, plus a list of “rewrite rules” that are activated whenever two nodes are connected by their main ports. Our system includes 6 types of node:

In our implementation, CON, OP1, OP2 and ITE require 128 bits, while NUM and ERA are unboxed, i.e., they’re stored inside other nodes and use no extra space. Notice our system doesn’t include a costly book-keeping machinery to keep track of Bruijn indices; instead, it can be seen as a practical extension to symmetric interaction-combinators, in order to add numeric primitives.
